availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Grogan (Calloway County, KY, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Sarah P. Grogan. Father of Charles F. Grogan, Rufus Grogan, John Grogan, Richard D. Grogan,Mary S. Grogan, Margarett Grogan, Joseph Grogan, Elizabeth Grogan, and Martha J. Gragham. Farmer in Calloway County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved people in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
